RegulatorySummary: Inhibition of Akt is caused by an increase in protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A)-mediated dephosphorylation (reference not chondrocyte specific)
UpstreamRegulator: decrease in Runx2 activity could be the reason for decrease in the level of Akt protein during treatment of chondrocytic cells with Dexamethasone. Not direct evidence but it Runx2 also known to upregulate Pi3k a direct AKT collaborating protein
Description: Phosphoinositide‐dependent serine/threonine protein kinase Akt, also called protein kinase B (PKB)

RegulatorySummary: Pi3K activates Akt by phosphorylation in chondrocytes. This constitute the analbolic PI3K/Akt pathway
Description: homozygous Akt1‐deficient (Akt1−/−) mice and Akt2−/− mice show similar phenotypes, including growth retardation
Akt1 MGI:87986 NCBI Gene: 11651. Akt1 is the dominant form (among Akt1, Akt2 and Akt3) in skeletal development & in chondrocyte
The Pi3K/Akt axis integrates signals from pro-catabolic and pro-anabolic stimuli and regulates seemingly opposite functions

UpstreamRegulator: Lef1 binding site was found in the ALK1 promoter (GeneCard https://www.genecards.org/cgi-bin/carddisp.pl?gene=ACVRL1&keywords=ALK1)
Description: Activin A receptor, type II-like 1. Acvrl1, MGI:1338946, NCBI Gene: 11482

UpstreamRegulator: Mathematically inferred interaction based on microarray data and presence of promoter binding domain for ATF2/c-JUN on ALK1 supported by Gene Card database (https://www.genecards.org/cgi-bin/carddisp.pl?gene=ACVRL1&keywords=ALK1)
Description: Upon ligand binding, they tranduces signal via phosphorylation of downstream proteins, such as Smads. They would promote rather pro-catabolic pathways and an increase of ALK1 amount and expression was obserged in ageing population and OA.

UpstreamRegulator: Binding of active TGFβ to activin receptor-like kinase 5 (ALK5) stimulates the expression of latent TGFβ1 and ALK5 while downregulating the expression of ALK1.
Description: Receptors of the TGF super familly, they normally function in dimers and may be activated both by TGF-beta of BMPs

UpstreamRegulator: Effect of ATF2 in the model is sytsematically implemented in conjonction with JNK signalling pathway (multipicative term). Indeed, ATF2 is a downstream effector mediatiung JNK sigbaling pathway. Moroever trnascriptional binding domain of c-JUN confirmed by Gene Card database (GH12J052180, https://www.genecards.org/cgi-bin/carddisp.pl?gene=ACVRL1&keywords=ALK1)
Description: Upon type I receptor activation (Alk1), intracellular signalling is initiated by C-terminal phosphorylation of receptor-regulated (R)-SMAD proteins. Whereas ALK5 stimulates phosphorylation of SMAD2 and SMAD3, ALK1 mediates the activation of SMAD1, SMAD5 and SMAD8. Phosphorylated R-SMADs form heteromeric complexes (trimers) with SMAD4, the common mediator SMAD (co-SMAD); the trimers are made up of two R-SMADs and one SMAD4. These heteromeric complexes accumulate in the nucleus where they, together with co-activators and repressors, control transcriptional responses. Frequently, these two main intracellular SMAD pathways are found to antagonize each other

UpstreamRegulator: Alk1 are overexpressed in hypertrophic chondrocytes and OA/ Runx2 being a master controller of the hypertrophic programme, a positive regulatory interaction was hypothesized. The existence of binding domains for the RUNX familly of transcription factors in the ALK1 promoter region was suported by GeneCard database (https://www.genecards.org/cgi-bin/carddisp.pl?gene=ACVRL1&keywords=ALK1 )

IL-1β has been shown to downregulate TGFβ type II receptor expression and inhibit TGFβ1-induced gene expression and SMAD2–SMAD3 phosphorylation. In the model type II receptors are not represented. The node ALK5 represents the effective heterodimer of type II receptors and the ALK5 type I receptor
Description: ALK5 or transforming growth factor, beta receptor I. MGI:98728, NCBI Gene: 21812

UpstreamRegulator: NfKB is the downstream transcriptional effector of pro-inflammatory cytokines and it was elsewhere shown to mediate IL-1B induced modulation of TGFB pathway (through up-regulation of Smad7)
Description: Transduces pro-anabolic signals upong TGFbeta ligands binding.
The ration ALK5/ALK1 decreases with ageing and osteoarthritis(OA). ALK5 downstream signalling would have a protective role against OA.
Loss of ALK5 induces osteoarthritis in mouse
The node ALK5 represents the effective heterodimer of type II receptors and the ALK5 type I receptor (Type II receptors are not represented in the model
Activating transcription factor 2 (Atf2 or Creb2): MGI:109349 , NCBI gene:11909
ATF2 also called CRE-BP1, CREB2, is a cAMP response element (CRE). It has a transcriptional activity and acts downstream of the TGF-β pathway
ATF-2 activation inhibits chondrocyte hypertrophy in mouse articular cartilage
The transcriptional responses to the JNK signal transduction pathway is mediated by ATF2
Activating transcription factor 4 (Atf4). Also known as AP-1 or CREB, MGI:88096, NCBI gene: 11911

ATF4 is a leucine-zipper-containing protein of the cAMP response element-binding protein (CREB) family. Ablation of Atf4 (Atf4−/−) in mice leads to severe skeletal defects, including delayed ossification and low bone mass, short stature and short limbs. Atf4 is expressed in proliferative and prehypertrophic growth plate and articular chondrocytes

RegulatorySummary: When the Wnt pathway in Off, Beta-catenin is caught by a destruction complex formed by GSK3B Axin, APC and other factors (summarized as 'DC' in the model). THis DC promote the promoting the phosphorylation and ubiquitination of B-catenin, ecentually leading to its degradation
Description: β-catenin was upregulated in articular cartilage during osteoarthritis.

RegulatorySummary: No transcriptional regulators were included in the GRN as the destruction complex is and assembly of several proteins, each with their own transcriptional regulators. For sake of simplification, these players weren't represented as individual components of the model
Description: Beta-catenin is an intracellular transducer of canonical Wnt pathway.
Ctnnb1. MGI:88276, NCBI gene:12387
Chondrocyte-specific B-catenin deletion results in decreased proliferation and delayed hypertrophic differentiation

UpstreamRegulator: Hh signalling would promote BMP gene expression. For instance, Ihh leads to a reduction of BMP2/4
Description: Bone Morphogenic proteins are important factors regulating chondrogenesis and skeletogenesis during normal embryonic development

UpstreamRegulator: NF-kappaB subunits (p50 and p65) bind to the NF-kappaB response elements of the BMP-2 gene and increase BMP-2 expression
Description: In growth plate BMP2 and 6 are not expressed in proliferative chondrocytes and the level rise till hypetrophy.
Overexpression of BMP2 was found in osteoarthritis tissues
e.g. Bmp2, MGI:88177; NCBI gene: 12156
The downstream effect of BMP ligands depends on the receptors they bind to. The model only includes a subset of potential downstream effects (noth canonical and non canonical)

UpstreamRegulator: Together with ATF2, Smad3 actiavte TGF-beta regulated genes, including CCND1
Description: MGI:88313, NCBI gene: 12443

UpstreamRegulator: CyclinD1 is a target of Gli2 transcription factors. Gli2 promote CCND1 expression in chondrocyte
Upregulation of Cyclin D expression by Hh signalling mediates the distinct ability of Hh to promote cellular growth in various systems. (not chondrocyte specific)

Significant and time-dependent upregulations of the expression of cyclin D1 mRNA and CDK4 protein were observed by the treatment with PTHrP, which prevents chondrocyte hypertrophy. PTHrP signalling transduces to the nucleus via PKA/CREB. In the model it is modelled via a direct link between PKA and the target genes (CCND1 in that case)
TGFb induced ATF2/Creb2 activates Cyclin D1 expression
FOXO, in synergy with the TGF-beta pathway (here represented by Smad3) promotes the expression of p21 and cyclin dependant kinase inhibitor.
FOXO would promote Cyclin D expression (FOXO KEGG pathway)

RegulatorySummary: Pro-inflammatory cytokines (e.g. IL-1β and TNF-α) activate signals that lead to the inhibition of Col2a1 expression
UpstreamRegulator: Mathematically inferred interaction based on microarray data
Description: Type II collagen (col2a1): MGI:88452, NCBI gene:12824

UpstreamRegulator: Sox9 promotes expression of Collagen-II in chondrocyte, a major ECM protein whose presence is important for healthy articular cartilage maintenance
Description: Type II collagen is one of the major component of extracellular matrix (ECM) surrounding proliferative or stable chondrocytes, it amount to 15–22% of the ECM by wet weight

UpstreamRegulator: Nkx3.2 promote chondrogenisis notably by inducing Col-II expression and GAG
Description: Collagen is present in the shape of fibers in the pericellular and extracellular cartilage matrix. One of the hallmark of osteoarthritis is the replacement of type II collagen by other types, sucha as type X collagen secreted by hypertophic chondrocytes.

UpstreamRegulator: Inflammatory signals reduce Col2a1 expression, notably by blocking FOXO activty
Description: The so called "Type II" collagen in cartilage is really a type II, IX and XI combo of fibers
Type collagen is one of the main component of extracellular matrix typically secreted by hypertrophic chondrocytes, contributing to cartilage mineralization during osteoarthritis

UpstreamRegulator: Collagen10 is a downtream target of Hif2-alpha. Hif2a promotes Col-X gene expression.
Description: Type X collagen (col10a1): MGI:88445, NCBI gene: 12813

UpstreamRegulator: Runx2 induces Collagen10 expression in chondrocyte and contributes to its hypertrophic chondrocyte-specific expression
Type-X collagen expression is increase by BMP in chondrocytes
MEF2C activity is required for normal Col-X promotor activity
Collagen-X expression is increased by BMP signalling (transduced via R-smad here)
There is a PTH/PTHrP-responsive region in the human COL10A1 enhancer
PTHrP signalling transduces to the nucleus via PKA/CREB. In the model it is modelled via a direct link between PKA and the target genes, even though PKA is not a transcription factor per say.

p65 (NfkB fragment) increased ZEB-1 promoter activity. And Zeb1 is induced by TNF-a (an inducer of NfkB). (Reference not chondrocyte-specific but if binding site of NfkB present in Zeb1--promoter, it is likely to be also present in chondrocyte were Nfkb also happend to be expressed))
Description: This gene encodes a zinc finger transcription factor. It can act as positive or negative transcriptional regulator

UpstreamRegulator: Decrease of delta-EF1 expression by BMP siganlling (but not shown in chondrocyte: breast cancer)
Description: [delta]-EF1 or Zeb1. MGI:1344313, NCBI gene:: 21417

UpstreamRegulator: TGF-beta would induce the expression of Ets1, which in turn activates deltaEF1 promoter activity. (not chondrocyte specific reference). This is summarized by activation of d-EF1 expression by Smad3, which is a downstream nuclear effector of TGFbeta
Description: Zeb1 is expressed in cartiage and is increased in osteoarthritic patients, it may be contribute to chondrocyte hypertophy and OA.
d-EF1 (or Zeb1) play a central role in the decrease of collagen II and cartilage matrix production

RegulatorySummary: Activation of Dsh lead to the recrutment of the DC complex at protein level, no transcriptional regulators were found and included in the GRN model. See protein signaling subnetwork for more information
Description: Complex formed with GSK3beta (MGI:1861437) and other molecules

When the wnt pathway is off, the transcriptional coactivator β-catenin is degraded by a multiprotein "destruction complex" that includes the tumor suppressors Axin and adenomatous polyposis coli (APC), the Ser/Thr kinases GSK-3 and CK1, protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), and the E3-ubiquitin ligase β-TrCP.

the transcriptional coactivator β-catenin is degraded by a multiprotein "destruction complex" that includes the tumor suppressors Axin and adenomatous polyposis coli (APC), the Ser/Thr kinases GSK-3 and CK1, protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), and the E3-ubiquitin ligase β-TrCP.

UpstreamRegulator: TGF-b regulate Wnt signalling in chondrocytes by downregulating the Wtn antagonist DKK1, in a p38 dependant way. The downstream nuclear effector of the TGF-b/p38 pathway in the model
Description: dickkopf 1 homolog (Dkk1). MGI:1329040, NCBI gene: 13380

UpstreamRegulator: There is a Wnt signalling feeback loop, Wnt signalling decreases transcriptional expression of Wnt antagonists Frzb and DKK1 and of BMP antagonist, Grem1
Description: DKK1 mRNA level negatively correlates with osteoarthritis and is regulated by osteoarthritis-associated factors. Dkk1 is a natural brake on hypertrophic differentiation in articular cartilage

UpstreamRegulator: DKK1 transcript level negatively correlates with OA. DKK1 is expressed in non hypetrophic chondrocyte (expressing Sox9). This regulatory link enable Sox9+ chondrocyte to express DKK1 in the model. This is a calibration choice but not direct supporting evidence/
Description: dickkopf 1 homolog (DKK1) is a Wnt antagonist

UpstreamRegulator: Stronger BMP signaling results in the upregulation of WNT antagonists, establishing a negative feedback mitigating WNT signaling
Description: Antagonizes canonical Wnt signaling by inhibiting LRP5/6 interaction with Wnt and by forming a ternary complex with the transmembrane protein KREMEN that promotes internalization of LRP5/6

UpstreamRegulator: Single and repeated treatments with Il-1B reduced mRNA levels of DKK1 in adult articular chondrocytes. Nfkb being the main transcriptional tranducer of the IL-1b pro inflammatory cytokines, this hypothetic regulatory link between Nfkb and Dkk1was added in the model
MEF2C is required for normal Dlx5 expression (reference for cranofacial developement)
Description: homeobox transcription factor similar to Drosophila distal-less, important role in bone development and healing. NB: Homeobox proteins are transcription factors that direct proper development by regulating specific temporal and spatial patterns of gene expression.

UpstreamRegulator: TGF-B1 signalling suppresses Dlx5 expression, it is modeled by inhibtion of Dlx5 expression by Smad3, the downtream transcription fator of TGF-B1 pathway
Description: Dlx5 is expressed in (pre)hypertrophic chondrocyte and has a transcription activity promoting hypertrophy. Notably it would directly bind and activate Runx2 promotor.

UpstreamRegulator: BMP signalling induces Dlx5 gene expression, Smad Complex is the downstream effector of BMP pathway in the model.
Description: distal-less homeobox 5: MGI:101926, NCBI gene:13395

UpstreamRegulator: BMP2 induction of Runx2 expression passes is mediated by Dlx5 upregulation. Overexpression of Smad1 or Smad5 stimulate Dlx5 transcription

Msx2 and Dlx5 might influence each other transcriptional level by supression of their respective expression. In the model they are involved in a negative feedback loop both at the protein and transcriptional level

Description: The Wnt signal leads, through its receptor, to activation of Dishevelled
MGI:98297, NCBI gene: 20423

RegulatorySummary: No upstream transcriptional regulators know or reported for cartilage
Description: Ets Familly (Elk1) NCBI Gene: 13712 / (Ets1) MGI:95455, NCBI gene: 23871
Ets1, the founding member of the Ets transcription factor family is involved in several developmental processes. It also controls expression of cytokine and chemokine genes (Uniprot).
They are transcription factors acting downstream of MAPK signalling. In particular they are activated by ERK1/2
These transcription factors regulate numerous target genes alone or in collaboration with other factors
For instance Elk-1 (NCBI Gene: 13712) is part of the Ets familly of transcription factors and transduces signals downtsream of MAPK to the nucleus. We consider Ets1 and Elk1 redundant in this model
Mitogen-activated protein kinase ERK2: Mapk1: MGI:1346858, NCBI gene: 26413
Mitogen-activated protein kinase or extracellular signal-regulated kinase. ERK1: Mapk3: MGI:1346859, NCBI gene: 26417
It is a signaling kinase protein transducing signals in the MAPK signalling pathways. It stands at the end of the cascade to phosphorylate and thereby activate various transcription factors.

RegulatorySummary: Promoter activation by Runx2 and B-catenin leading to FGF ligands gene expression. Migh need further refinement to distinguish between the different types of FGF ligands (FGF2, FGF18, etc..)
UpstreamRegulator: Wnt signalling is requited to induces FGF (at least FGF-8, FGF-10) in mouse growth plate
Description: Fribroblast Growth factor ligands e.g. fgf18 (shown to bind fgfr3 and promote chondrogenisis). MGI:1277980 , NCBI gene:14172

UpstreamRegulator: RUNX2 controls FGF18 expression in the perichondrium and thus FGFR3 activation and chondrocyte proliferation in the growth plate. Does Runx2 also promotes fgf18 in (AC) chodnrocyte
Description: FGF2 was identified as a degenerative mediator (promote catabolism) in Osteoarthritis, although its exact role is controversial
FGFs 2, 9 and in particular FGF18 together with the receptors FGFR1 and 3 are implicated in growth plate development.
Via receptor activation, FGF ligands signal through various transduction pathways such as Ras/Raf/MEK/MAPK, PI3k/Akt, STAT1,
Fribroblast Growth factor signalling is essential for skeletal development as was first put in evidence with FGFR mutation associated bone morphongenic disorder such as achondroplasia (dwarfism)

Different FGF ligands have been shown to preferientially bind to different receptors and activate differential responses. For sake of simplification, only a global FGF node was introduce in the current model, however, making the dinstinction between FGF2 and FGF18 ligands, for example, might be important and subject to future imrpovments.

The pro-anabolic or pro-catabolic nature of FGF ligands depends on the receptors mediating the signal, blocking on type of receptor has emerged as potential therapeutic strategy to tip the role of FGF signaling during OA
Using recombinant FGF18 migh be good therapeutic strategy against osteoarthritis as was demonstrated by several clinical trials

RegulatorySummary: up regulation of gene expression level
UpstreamRegulator: Fgfr1 is upregulated in (pre)hypertorphic chondrocytes, Fgfr3 is expressed in proliferative chondrocyte and disappears in later stage of chodrocyte maturation. Fgfr1 was reported to be upregulated in OA chondrocyte. To translate this in the model, fgfr1 expression is activated by Runx2 a major regulator gene activator in hypertophy
Description: fgfr1 (FGF receptor 1) MGI:95522 , NCBI gene:14182

UpstreamRegulator: BMP signalling inhibits FGF signalling by inhibiting Fgfr1 expression in growth plate chondrocytes
Description: FGFR1 inhibitors protect against cartilage degradation in a murine model of osteoarthritis
FGFR3 and FGFR1 are the major FGF receptor isoforms expressed in human articular cartilage and the modification of a balance between the two might contribute to OA
FGFR1 is expressed in hypetrophic chondrocytes and tabecular bone
Fgfr1 promotes osteoarthitis in articular cartilage. Loss of Fgfr1 reduces hypertophic differentiation
FGF2 pro-anabolic effect on cartilage would be transduced by FGFR1

UpstreamRegulator: Fgfr1 is upregulated in (pre)hypertorphic chondrocytes, Fgfr3 is expressed in proliferative chondrocyte and disappears in later stage of chondrocyte maturation. To translate this in the model, fgfr1 expression is activated by Runx2 while Fgfr3 by Sox9
Description: MGI:95524, NCBI gene:14184

UpstreamRegulator: SOX9 upregulates Fgfr3
Description: Fgfr3 is expressed in proliferating and prehypertrophic chondrocytes and functions to inhibit postnatal chondrogenesis

UpstreamRegulator: "FGFR3 was negatively regulated by FGF-2 at the transcriptional level through the FGFR1-ERK (extracellular signal-regulated kinase) signaling pathway in human articular chondrocytes." This corroborate with the notion that the balance between fgfr1 and fgfr3 is of high importance for cartilage homeostasis. Elk-1 tranduces ERK1/2 signal into the nucleus, a ERK1/2 dependent inhibition of Fgfr3 was introduce to account for that.

Description: Removal of FGFR3 leads to overgrowth . activating mutations in FGFR3 account for several dysplasias such as achondrodysplasia (dawrfism)
FGFR‐3 signaling may have a chondroprotective role during the development of OA and FGFR3 expression is downregulated in articular cartilage from OA patients
Deletion of Fgfr3 in chondrorcytes leads to osteoarthritis

RegulatorySummary: IL-1β and TNF-α supress FOXO1 expression in chondrocytes. This effect is reflected by an inhibitory link between NFkB, the downstream transcriptional effector, and FOXO in the GRN
Description: Forkhead Box O. E.g. Foxo1 MGI:1890077, NCBI Gene: 56458

RegulatorySummary: MAPK pathways are involved in FOXOs downregulation in a JNK dependant way. No information was found about the downstream transcription factor involved in that regulation so the inhibitory effect was attributed to a joint effect (mutliplicative term) of the two effectors of JNK in the model: ELK1 and ATF2.
Description: Regulation of transcription

RegulatorySummary: interleukin-1β or tumour necrosis factor also caused rapid downregulation of FoxO1 via c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) of which Elk1 and ATF2 are downstream effectors in the model
Description: FOXO synergize with the TGF-beta pathway to regulate downstream targets

RegulatorySummary: TGF-b contributes to FOXO1 transcriptonal expression: the downstream effector of TGF-b in the model is ATF2
Description: Deletion of Foxo showed that it is involved in expression of Col2a1 and Acan in cartilage
FOXO expression is dyregulated (reduced) during ageing and osteoarthritis.
FOXO is involved in the regulation of several ECM component and the deletion of Foxo resulted in spontenous degradation of articular cartilage.

RegulatorySummary: Activated by Wnt binding at protein level, no transcriptional regulators were found and included in the GRN model. See protein signaling subnetwork for more information.
Description: LRP5: MGI:1278315 NCBI Gene: 16973. / LRP6: MGI:1298218 NCBI Gene: 16974.
Frizzled-LRP5/6 represents the (frizzled)/co-receptor (lipoprotein receptor-related protein-LRP-5/6) complex
The Wnt pathway is activated by binding of WNT to Frizzled family receptors

UpstreamRegulator: Frzb promoter is regulated by direct binding of CREB.
Description: Frizzled-related protein (Frzb) or secreted frizzled-related protein 3 (sFRP3) : MGI:892032, NCBI gene: 20378
Frzb mRNA level negatively correlates with osteoarthritis and is regulated by osteoarthritis-associated factors. Frzb is a natural brake on hypertrophic differentiation in articular cartilage

UpstreamRegulator: FrzB transcript level negatively correlates with OA. FRzB is expressed in non hypetrophic chondrocyte (expressing Sox9). This regulatory link enable Sox9+ chondrocyte to express Frzb in the model
Description: Verapamil (overexpressing sFRP3) protects against cartilage degradation in osteoarthritis by inhibiting Wnt/β-catenin signaling

UpstreamRegulator: " Stronger BMP signaling results in the upregulation of WNT antagonists, establishing a negative feedback mitigating WNT signaling"
Description: FrzB may have a protective role against cartilage degradation and MMP induction in mouse chondrocytes by attenuating deleterious effects of the activation of the canonical Wnt/β-catenin pathway.

UpstreamRegulator: Single and repeated treatments with Il-1B reduced mRNA levels of FRZB in adult articular chondrocytes. Nfkb being the main transcriptional tranducer of the IL-1b pro inflammatory cytokines, this hypothetic regulatory link between Nfkb and FRZB was added in the model
Description: Frzb deficient mices have reduction of cell proliferation and differentiation in the articular cartilage - subchondral bone
"Frizzled related proteins (Frps) are secreted proteins structurally similar to frizzled receptors; they bind Wnt via the cysteine-rich domain and antagonize the Wnt signaling pathway"

UpstreamRegulator: Enhanced Indian hedgehog signaling and RUNX2 expression in Fgfr3 conditional KO mice. enhanced Runx2 might be a consequence on Ihh/Gli2 signalling activation
Description: Glioma-associated oncogene family members (Gli1/2/3) act as a transcription factor downtream of hedgehog signalling in skeletal cells

UpstreamRegulator: The mechanisms of action for the regulation of IHH expression by FGFR3 is yet elusive but it would activate ERK/MAPK without donwstream activation of Runx2 or Elk-1 (Ets1) activity but leading to downregulation of Gli2 and Ihh expresion. Even though FGFR3 is not a transcription factor, this effect was modelled by a direct inlfuence of FGFR3 activity on Ihh and GLi2 expression.
Description: MGI:95728 , NCBI gene:14633

UpstreamRegulator: Grem1 transcript is dowregulated upon depletion of Sox9
Description: Gremlin mRNA level correlates with osteoarthritis (strongly decreased) and is regulated by osteoarthritis-associated factors. It is a natural brakes on hypertrophic differentiation in articular cartilage

UpstreamRegulator: Grem1 transcript level negatively correlate with OA. Grem1 is expressed in non hypetrophic chondrocyte (expressing Sox9). This regulatory link enable Sox9+ chondrocyte to express Grem1 in the model
Description: Gremlin1 (Grem1): MGI:1344337, NCBI gene: 23892
Grem1 has a BMP binding kinase activity, it functions has an antagonist to BMP signalling

RegulatorySummary: GSK3b is modulated at protein level, but no transcriptional regulators were found and/or included in the GRN subnetwork. See protein signaling subnetwork for more information
Description: Proxy for free GSK3beta (= GSK3B not included in Destruction complex). So it represent the activity of GSK3beta in other signalling parhway than the Wnt/Bcat one.

Glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta is is a multifunctional serine/threonine kinase found in all eukaryotes. It is involved in several cellular signalling pathways where it controls activity of downtream factors including transcription factors
MGI:1861437, NCBI gene: 56637

RegulatorySummary: PP2A, which is activated by PKA, promotes dephosphorylation of HDAC4, which translocates into the nucleus and represses the activity of MEF2 transcription factors, ultimately attenuating the rate of chondrocyte hypertrophy
Description: Histone deacetylase 4: MGI:3036234, NCBI gene:208727

RegulatorySummary: HDAC4 is modulated at protein level, but no transcriptional regulators were found and/or included in the model. See protein signaling subnetwork for more information
Description: Overexpression of HDAC4 in proliferating chondrocytes, in vivo, inhibits hypertrophy and differentiation.

Histone deacetylases (HDACs) modulate cell growth and differentiation by governing chromatin structure and repressing the activity of specific transcription factors. HDAC4 affects transcription fators access to DNA

"Acetylation of lysine residues within histone protein tails reduces their affinity for DNA, thereby relaxing the chromatin structure and increasing the accessibility of DNA to transcription factor. [...] Histone deacetylases (HDACs) are capable of reversing this process by removing the acetyl moiety and, therefore, allowing histones to bind tightly to DNA again"

RegulatorySummary: Induction of HIF2α by Nfkb induces the activation of the Ihh and Runx2.axis followed by various pro-catabolic responses.
UpstreamRegulator: NfkB is an inducer of Hif2-a promoter in chondrocytes, Nfkb would bind to the EPAS1 enhancer promoter upstream of Ihh
Description: Hif-2alpha (hypoxic inducible factor alpha) coded by the gene Epas1, MGI:109169 , NCBI gene:13819

UpstreamRegulator: " the proinflammatory cytokines tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α) and interleukin-1β (IL-1β), putative inducers of the NF-κB signal28, increased EPAS1 expression in cultured chondrogenic cells"
Description: Hif-2alpha is induced in cartilage during hypoxia and HIF-2alpha enhanced promoter activities of COL10A1, MMP13 and VEGFA through specific binding to the respective hypoxia-responsive elements
Hif2-alpha was associated with knee osteoarthritis in genetic population study, alhtough this association was not supported by various ethnic population study as reported in (M.Nakajima et al.)

HIF2α is a catabolic transcription factor with a likely role in the osteoarthritic process. HIF2α can become activated by pro-inflammatory cytokines and stress in the avascular, hypoxic environment of articular cartilage

UpstreamRegulator: NfkB was proven to bind to IGF-1R promotor. It stimulates its expression
Description: Insulin growth factor receptor (Igf1r): MGI:96433, NCBI gene:16001

UpstreamRegulator: TGF-beta and IGFI were shown to have a combined effect on chondrocyte differentiation. Moreover, TGFbeta treatment would increase the number of IGFI receptor in articular chondrocyte. TGFbeta is not a transcription factor so the aforementionned observation are taken into account by upregulation of IGFI-R expression by TGF-beta's downstream effector: Smad3
Description: Ligand binding leads to the IGF-I receptor phosphorylation, subsequently activating its tyrosine kinase activity.

UpstreamRegulator: Uncertainty
Description: Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 (Igf1, IGF-I). MGI:96432, NCBI gene:16000

UpstreamRegulator: NfKb binds and activates IGFI promotor
Description: Insulin-like Growth Factor 1, IGF1 is involved in metabolism regulation and is very important for growth during development.
There is a complex and cell stage-specific anabolic action of IGF-I in the growth plate
In articular chondrocytes, IGF-I regulates differentiation, maintenance of the differentiated phenotype, and apoptosis via a PI-3 kinase pathway that modulates ERK, p38 kinase, and PKC signaling

IGF-I is know is able to promote cartilage matrix production. Even though it was reported ot be overexpressed in osteoarthritis (OA), its bio-availability at the protein level is curtailed by other factors during OA
IGF-I signalling is an important driver of cartilage anabolism and, disturbance of this pathway could be related to osteoarthritis

UpstreamRegulator: Ihh expression is up-regulated in absence or with deletion of FGFR3 in articular chondrocytes. FGFR3 is not a transcriptional regulator so this link is most likely indirect but the mechanism is not yet fully understood, so we accounted for that information with the current indirect link
Description: MGI:96533, NCBI gene:16147

UpstreamRegulator: The mechanisms of action for the regulation of IHH expression by FGFR3 is still elusive but it go through activation of the ERK/MAPK axis without donwstream activation of Runx2 or Elk-1 (Ets1) activity but leading to downregulation of Gli2 and Ihh expresion. Even though FGFR3 is not a transcription factor, this effect was modelled by a direct inlfuence of FGFR3 activity on Ihh and GLi2 expression.
Description: Ihh is involved in a major feedback loop with PthrP to regulate chondrocyte differentiation in the growth plate. Ihh stimulates the production of PTHrP and thereby delays chondrocyte hypertrophy. Overall it is major regulator on chondrocyte phenotype

UpstreamRegulator: Data of RT-PCR revealed that Gli1, Runx2 , Col10 Mmp13 and Adamts5 expressions were increased significantly in Fgfr3 cKO mice compared to Cre-negative mice. This effect is reduced by treatment with inhibitor of Ihh signalling.
Description: Hedgehog (Hh) signalling pathway has critical function in bone formation. In particular Indian Hedgehog (Ihh) has an essential function in endochondral ossification

UpstreamRegulator: Runx2 activates Ihh promoter and thus stimulates its expression
Description: IHH-PTHrP would also participate in the maintenance of articular cartilage. Dysregulation of this system might contribute to the pathogenesis of arthritis.

UpstreamRegulator: mutant mice deficient for Runx2 leads to a decrease in Ihh expression
Description: Ihh is normally upregulated togehter with Runx2 in (pre)hypertophic chondrocytes

UpstreamRegulator: BMP signalling induces Ihh expression (but effect of BMP on proliferation in independant of Ihh). BMP signalling is tranduces by Smad complex in the model
Description: Modulating Ihh signalling would be a therapeurical strategy for osteoarthritis

UpstreamRegulator: (weak link:not chondrocyte context + no ihh but shh) Nuclear factor-kappaB regulates hedghog signalling in part through upregulation of shh expression.
Msx2 overexpression induces Ihh expression in mouse primary chondrocytes and thereby it may play a role in chondrocyte maturation
delta-EF1 (or Zeb1) is a negative regulator of Ihh expression in growth plate chondrocytes
ATF4 influences chondrocyte proliferation by activating Ihh expression
ATF4-deficient mice show reduced expression of Ihh, ATF4 binds to the promoter region of the Ihh gene, and treatment with a hedgehog agonist rescue limb development in ATF4-deficient mice

RegulatorySummary: Nfkb and IkBa are invovled in a negative regulatory feedback loop since Nfkb is able to promote the expression of its own inhibitor.
Description: Nuclear factor of kappa light polypeptide gene enhancer in B cells inhibitor, alpha (I(Kappa)B(alpha) or Nfkbi). MGI:104741, NCBI Gene: 18035
IκBα is a specific inhibitor of Nfkb, it binds and sequestrate Nfkb proteins in the cytosol as well as promote its translocation outside the nucelus thereby preventing its transcriptional activity

RegulatorySummary: Pro-inflammatory cytokines are involved in a positive feedback loop. These cytokines activate the IRAL/TAK1/ NF-kB axis. Nfkb upregulates the epression of numerous chemokines and pro-inflammatory cytokines. Moreover MAPK pathways, activated by pro-inflmmatory cytokines, promote production of MMP13 and regulate the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines such as TNFα and IL-1
Description: Pro-inflammatory cytokines such as interleukin-1β (IL-1B) or TNF-α (TNF-alpha)

RegulatorySummary: MAPK pathways (Ras-ERK-Elk1/ JNK-ATF2) converge to upregulates expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines,such as TNFα and IL-1, during osteoarthritis
Description: Several pro-inflammatory cytokines can be senses by chondrocytes and activate downstream pathways, this node represent typical cytokines such as IL-1 aof TNF-alpha with generic pro-inflammatory pathways without making distinctions for the subtility of each kind of pro-inflammatory cytokines

Even though osteoarthrtis is not a typical inflammatory disease (low synovitis grade), several pro-inflammatory pathways are overactivated in that disease and play an important role cartilage physiology
Pro-inflammatory cytokines upregulate catabolic processes, ECM degrading enzymes and other pro-inflammatory mediator, which constitutes a feedforward loop
c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) or mitogen-activated protein kinase 8 (Mapk8). MGI:1346861. NCBI Gene: 26419

It is a signaling kinase protein transducing signals in the MAPK signalling pathways together with ERK1/3 and p38. It stands at the end of the cascade to phosphorylate and thereby activate various transcription factors.
It is involved in the transduction of pro-inflammatory signals and the downstream transcriptional effectors represented in the model are Elk1/Ets and ATF2

UpstreamRegulator: [The Wnt homepage: Nusse website]. There is a positive feedback loop. Activation of Wnt pathway leads to upregulation of Lef/TCF7 gene expression, themselves downstream effectors of Wnt pathway
Description: When the Wnt pathway is activated LEF/TCF direclty bind to the Runx2 promotor to activate Runx2 transcription.

UpstreamRegulator: RUNX2 induces Tcf7 (and probably lef1) expression by direct binding to the promoters in chondrocytes
Description: Tcf7: MGI:98507; ncbi gene: 21414
LEF and TCF7 are transcription factors downstream of Wnt pathway. They regulate the experssion of Wnt targets.

RegulatorySummary: PTHrP induces dephosphorylation of histone deacetylase 4 (HDAC4), which promotes nuclear translocation of HDAC4 and repression of MEF2 transcriptional activity.
UpstreamRegulator: MEF2C might be a target of Runx2 since it is differentially expressed in Runx2-double KO mouse model
Description: Myocyte enhancer factor 2C (Mef2c): MGI:99458, NCBI gene:17260

RegulatorySummary: HDAC4 has a repressive effect on MEF2C-dependant expression of Runx2
Description: Among the 4 mammal MEF2 genes, MEF2C have been shown to have an important role in bone development
MEF2C is expressed in (pre)hypertrophic chondrocyte promote expression, at the transcriptional level, of genes related to hypertrophy such as Col-X
MEF2C operates upstream of Runx2 in chondrocyte hypertrophy and that is it directly or indirectly responsible for its expression.

RegulatorySummary: Various signaling pathways involving the receptor of inflammation/TAK1/Nfkb axis or the MAPK/p38, JNK and ERK1/2 axis; converge on the MMP13 gene transcription in chondrocyte
UpstreamRegulator: MMP13 is a downtream target of Hif2-Alpha. Hif2a promotes mmp13 gene expression
Description: mmp1, collagenase-3: MGI:1340026, NCBI gene: 17386

RegulatorySummary: MMPs mRNA increases upon treatment with Il-1beta in articular chondrocytes
UpstreamRegulator: Deletion of FOXO resulted in increase Mmp13 expression in articular cartilage
Description: MMP13 is a matrix degrading enzyme typically secreted by hypertrophic chondrocytes. It would be one of the major actor of matrix degradation during endochondral ossification but also osteoarthritis

UpstreamRegulator: activation of NfKB pathway promotes production of catabolic enzymes such as MMP13 during OA in human articular cartilage.
Description: MMPs are produced by chondrocyte after pro-inflammatory stimuli

UpstreamRegulator: Bloackage of MAPK/NfkB pathway in OA chondrocyte reduce MMP13 expression
There is a Cbfa1 (Runx2) binding site in MMP13 promoter
MMP13 is a target gene of Runx2. Runx2 promote MMP13 expression
MAPK/p38 would promote MMP13 expression during osteoarthritis
Various potential OA treatment decreasing MMP13 production and expression would pass by inhibtion of MAPK/p38 pathway
Hedgehog signalling promotes chondrocyte hypertrophy and upregulation of MMP-13 in human osteoarthritic cartilage

However there are controversial effet reported since Studies in other cell type show that Gli2 activity downregulate MMP13. (initial growth plate model included a negative link between Gli2 and MMP13)
Elk-1 is a direct target of NFkappaB and induces MMP-13 expression upon activation of the NFkappaB signaling pathway

In articular cartilage, FGF1 activates MAPK/ERK1/2 as well as PKC pathways and they coordinately activate Ets1/Elk1 transcription factor. In this way, Ets1 mediate FGF1-induced upregulation of Runx2 and catabolic proteins such as MMP13 and ADAMTS5 (Aggrecanase). In the model the end node 'MMP13' can as well represent Aggrecanase expression since they would be upregulated in similar circumstances
MAPKs signal through Ets1 (Elk-1) and promotes expression of MMP13 in OA
JNK pathway, which mediates phosphorylation of AP-1/Jun family members, as well as Elk-1 and ATF-2, is required for cytokine induction of MMP-1 and MMP-13

TGF-beta dependant activation of ALK5 trigger anti-anabolic and pro-catabolic signals including reduction of MMP13 expression. The pro-catabolic effect of TGF-beta is tranduced by Smad3 in the model (see ref TGF-B & ALK5).
See ATF2
The Ras-ERK and JNK pathway induces phosphorylation of ATF2 and transcription of downstream targets. MMP13 mRNA expression is activated collaboratively by the MAPK pathways (JNK-ATF2/ERK-Elk1)

RegulatorySummary: Dlx5 stimulates Runx2 activity and negatively regulates Msx2 activity. Evidence suggests Dlx5 might achieve these effects through interfering with interactions between Msx2 and Runx2 (Dodig et al., 1999).
UpstreamRegulator: Dlx5 can bind to Msx2 promotor and was shown to be involved in negative feedback loop. They might influence each other transcriptional level by supression of their respective expression
Description: mesh-less homeobox 2 (Msx2) Synonym: hox8. MGI:97169, NCBI gene:17702

UpstreamRegulator: BMP-2 upregulates expression of Msx2 in chondrocytes. "The stimulatory effect of Msx2 on chondrocyte maturation was enhanced by overexpression of Smad1 and Smad4 " Smad1 and Smad4 form the Smad Complex which tranduce BMP signalling in the nucleus
Description: Variation of Msx2 expression was shown to be associated with osteoarthritis

UpstreamRegulator: TGF-B1 signalling would stimulate Msx2 expression (weak reference or not chondrocyte specifc)
Description: mesh-less 2 (Msx2) is expressed in resting and proliferating chondrocytes. Msx2−/− mice show, in addition to other phenotypes, defects in both endochondral and intramembranous ossification

UpstreamRegulator: Msx2 was shown to bind to its own promoter sequence thereby autoactivating its expression. (in transgenic mouses, during limb development)
Description: Msx2 is an homeobox protein. Homeobox proteins are transcription factors that direct proper development by regulating specific temporal and spatial patterns of gene expression
Nuclear factor of kappa light polypeptide gene enhancer in B cells (NFkb1 or p50: MGI:97312 , NCBI gene:18033) / (Rela/p65 : NCBI: 19697)
NfkB is central in the intracellular transduction on pro-inflammatory signals.
NF-kappa-B is a homo- or heterodimeric complex formed by the Rel-like domain-containing proteins RELA/p65, RELB, NFKB1/p105, NFKB1/p50, REL and NFKB2/p52
NF-κB regulates the expression of many cytokines and chemokines, adhesion molecules, inflammatory mediators, and several matrix degrading enzymes
NfkB is involved in the pathophysiology of osteoarthritis

Nfkb is activated following pro-inflammatory signal sensing by the cells. It is key in transducing the downstream signals: TAK1 activates nuclear factor B (IκB) kinase 2 (IKK2), which phosphorylates ΙκΒα, the inhibitor of NF-κB, thereby fixing it on proteosomal degradation. Whent he inhibitor of Nfkb is degraded, the transcription factor is free to translocate to the nucleus and actiavted downstream targets sucha as Mmp13, Hih2a, Ihh, etc..

UpstreamRegulator: Sox9 directly binds to Nkx3.2 promoter and up-regulates its expression. Nkx3.2 expression contributes to Runx2 downregulation by Sox9 activity
Description: NK3 homeobox 2 (nkx3-2), also called Bapx1: MGI:108015, NCBI gene: 12020

UpstreamRegulator: PTHrP signals block chondrocyte hypertrophy, in part, by maintaining the expression of Nkx3.2/Bapx1. PKA is not a transcription factor therefore this link is indirect, however it allows to account for the upregulation of Nkx3.2 by PthrP signalling
Description: Nkx3.2 is an homeobox protein, therefore it has a transcriptional activity. It is strongly involved int he process of endochondral ossification. It notably act concomitantly with Sox9 to repress the expression of Runx2. It is a negative regulator of chondrocyte maturation
Overexpression of Nkx3.2 promotes and inhibition of Nkx3.2 suppresses chondrogenic differentiation. It promotes Col-II and GAG epxression.
p28 or mitogen-activated protein kinase 14 (Mapk14) MGI:1346865, NCBI gene: 26416
p38 are mammalian MAPKs activated by the upstream kinases MKK3 and MKK6. p38 phosphorylation is increased during chondrogenisis and inhibition of p38activity blocks chondrogenisis
Phosphorylation of p38 is higher in human OA compared to normal tissue and p38inhibitor was investigated as potential OA treatment
It may be involved in the control of the Sox9 function during chondrogensis via the BMP‐2/p38 pathway.
p38 has important effects on chondroycte maturation and may be o potential target for OA therapies but its exact role remains controversial as it is located at the crosstalk of several pathways

UpstreamRegulator: Runx2 upregulate protein levels of Pi3K by binding to promoter sites upstrem to the Pi3K gene
Description: Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (pi3kr1). MGI:97583, NCBI gene: 18708
The PI3K pathway control hypetrophic differentiation during endochondral ossification. PI3K inhibition reduces the length of the proliferating and particularly of the hypertrophic zone

the Pi3k/Akt axis lies at the crossroad of several pathways hence it potential dual role, depending on the cellular context and environement. For instance, pro-inflammatoiry cytokines, produced during OA, are able to activate that axis.

RegulatorySummary: Binding of PThrP on its receptor PPR promote formation of AMP cyclic (cAMP), which subsequently activate PKA.
Description: cAMP/protein kinase A (Prkaca), MGI:97592, NCBI gene: 18747

PKA is a protein kinase and CREB is a prototypical PKA downstream transcription factor transducing PKA signalling in the nucleus. CREB is not represented in the model since it would be linearly downstream of PKA, its nuclear action is directly operated by PKA in the model
cAMP dependent protein kinase (PKA) is involed in PTHrP signalling, it tranduces the signal by phosphorylation of the downstream targets

RegulatorySummary: PP2A is the direct messenger of PKA since PKA activates it by phosphorylation. When activated, PP2A subesquently modulates other downtream molecules
Description: Protein phosphatase 2 (formerly 2A) (Ppp2ca) MGI:1321159, NCBI gene: 19052

RegulatorySummary: the Wnt pathway control hypertophic differentiation by antagonizing PTHrP signaling via Beta-catenin. However, PTHrP is not upregulated by the Wnt pathway, Beta-catenin would rather block the PTHrP pathway activity by targetting downstream effectors.. An important downstream effector for that pathway in our model is the PP2A protein. Therefore we included an inhibitory transcriptional interaction between beta-catenin and PP2A
Description: Direct messenger of PKA downstream of the PTHrP growth factor. It is a negative regulator of ERK and AKT

It is involved in the regulation of several important regulators of chondrocyte maturation (HDAC4, AKT, ERK1/2, etc..) and also involved in the formation of the destruction complex within the Wnt/beta-catenin pathway

RegulatorySummary: PThrP signall through binding to its transmembranar receptor PPR. In the protein signalling model PTHrP activates PPR.
UpstreamRegulator: Not direct evidence but Gli2 promotes PTHrP expression in the context of Ihh/PTHrP feedback loop. To mimick activation of PThrP signalling by Ihh signalling, Gli2 also upregulated expression of PThrP receptors (PPR) in the model
Description: PPR or pth1r, parathyroid hormone 1 receptor. MGI:97801 , NCBI gene19228

UpstreamRegulator: PTHrP receptor PPR would also be a target of Ihh signalling (transduced by GLi2 transcription factor in the model)
Description: PTH/PTHrP receptor (PPR). Membranar receptor expressed by chondroctes and to which PThrP binds. Expression of this receptor will define if a cell is sensitive to PThrP signalling. PPR is expressed in pre-hypertrophic chondrocyte in the GP

UpstreamRegulator: Sox9 is required for the Ihh - Pthrp/PthrPreceptor loop to prevent conversion of proliferating chondrocytes into hypertrophic chondrocytes. PPR is expressed in prehypertrophic chodrocytes expressing Sox9 so upregulation of PPR expression by Sox9 transcription factor account for that in the model.
BMP2 downtsream effector is Smad complex in the model. "BMP‐2 induced the response of C2C12 cells to PTHrP", this effect passes by upregulation of PTH1R (PPR)
FGF signalling controls chondrocyte proliferation through the downstream effector STAT1
FGF/FGFR3 signalling decreases proliferation which is translated by an inhibitory effect of PTHrP receptor (PPR) expression.
"FGFR3 down-regulates PTH/PTHrP receptor gene expression by mediating JAK/STAT signaling in chondrocytic cell line"

RegulatorySummary: Upon treatment with pro-inflammatory cytokines, in particular with IL-1B, proteoglycans and GAG are not only degraded but an overall decrease of the biosynthesis is also observed in cartilage. Nfkb being the main transcriptional effector of IL-1B in the model and the production rate of proteoglycan being dependant on the gene expression, we introduce this regulatory link between Nfkb and the node for proteoglycans in the GRN
UpstreamRegulator: Overexpression of Sox9 increase Acan mRNA expression, suggesting that SOX9 regulates proteoglycan production as it does for other ECM proteins such as type II collagen.
Description: Proteoglycans are proteins that have been functionalized by some glycans. Aggrecans are the major type of proteoglycans in the articular cartilage

UpstreamRegulator: FOXO regulate expression of Prg4 (Proteolycan 4) in articular cartilage
Description: gene: Aggrecan Acan (or Agc1). MGI:99602, NCBI Gene: 11595

Proteoglycans are among the main constituents of the ECM, secreted by chondrocytes, they provide to cartilage its hydrogel property, which is essential for the load-bearing function of the knee joint.
Loss of proteoglycans is one of the hallmark of osteoarthritis
They provide to cartilage its load bearing function and biomechanical properties
Proteglycans give to articulat cartilage its ability to resist compressive loads

UpstreamRegulator: SOX9 binds to promotor region of PTHrP and up regulate its expression. Sox9 would inhibits late stage maturation of chondrocyte via up-regulation of parathyroid hormone-related protein.
Description: Pthlh, parathyroid hormone-like peptide, MGI:97800, NCBI gene:19227

UpstreamRegulator: Sox9 also mediates PrhrP upregulation in collaboration with ihh/Gli2
Description: Pathway Summary: PTHrP is a secreted factor that signals through PPR to activate PKA, Ca2+ transients and PKC pathways. Activation of the PTH/PTHrP receptor leads to activation of multiple G proteins. The activation of Gs leads to subsequent activation of adenylate cyclase and generation of cyclic AMP (cAMP). cAMP will then activate PKA, which will in turn phosphorylate Sox9, greatly increasing its activity.

UpstreamRegulator: Ihh and PthrP are involved in a negative feedback loop, which is major in regulating chondrocyte hypetrophy. Ihh induces production of PthrP, in the model Ihh signal is transduced by Gli2 in the nucleus.
Description: PTHrP/PThrP receptor signalling breaks down hypertophy in chondrocytes and are involved in a Ihh/PthrP feedback loop controlling chondrocyte differentiation

UpstreamRegulator: transition from proliferating into hypertrophic chondrocytes is regulated by Gli3-dependent expression of PTHrP. Gli3 is another effector downtsream to Ihh signalling. All downstream effects are summarized by the Gli2 node in the model
Description: PTHrP siganlling prevents premature chondrocyte hypertrophy notably by promoting Runx2 degradation. It also showed potential to inhibit hypertrophy in articular chondrocytes

UpstreamRegulator: Ihh/Gli2 and Sox9 collaborate to mediate PthrP upregulation during endochondral ossification
TGF-B controls and promotes PthrP expression through Smad3 signaling

Description: Receptor of inflammatory cytokines, e.g: Toll-like receptors for IL-beta or TNA-alpha

Most Pro-inflammatory cytokine activated pathways converge in the activation of the TAK1 kinase. This kinase is able to subsequently activate several pathways including ERK1/2/MAPK and NfkB related pathway. TAK1 unlock NfkB transcriptional activity via inhibtion of IkBa, a NfkB specific inhibitor.
Downstream target genes include ECM degrading enzymes (e.g. ADMATS5, MMP13) but gene coding for pro-inflammatory cytokines, which constitute a feedforward loop.

RegulatorySummary: BMP binds to Type II receptors which activates type I receptors and subsequently activates R-smads by phosphorylation
Description: Smad3/5/9. E.g. Smad5: MGI:1328787, NCBI gene:17129

receptor-activated Smads (R-smad) are activated when BMP binds to its membranar receptor and they associate with Smad4 to form the Smad-complex, which has a transcriptional activity in the nucleus and transduces BMP signal.
R-smads are Smad3/5/8 in human and Smad3/5/8 in mouse.

RegulatorySummary: Ras proteins is an imporant signal transducer of the MAPK pathways, it is only regulated at protein level, in the model current model
Description: GTPases of the Ras superfamily.

Ras is a proto-oncogne, part of the GTPases familly. Ras proteins are activated after activation of a transmembranar receptor (mainly EGFR Epidermal Growth Factor receptor for the canonical pathway). Activation of Ras by phosphorylation leads to downstream cascade of Kinase activation (MEK/ERK), which contributes to transduce the signal up to the nucleus.
the Ras protein and Ras/ERK1/2 axis are involved in many non-canonical biochemical signals

RegulatorySummary: HDAC4 represses Runx2 expression at the gene level. This occurs indirectly by acting as a corepressor of MEF2C transcription factor. This action is modeled by inhibtiion of MEF2C protein activity by HDAC4 at the PPI level
UpstreamRegulator: In articular cartilage, FGF1 activates MAPK/ERK1/2 as well as PKC pathways and they coordinately activates Ets1 transcription factor (Ets1 and Elk1 transcription factors downstream of ERK activation are represented by the same node in the model).In this way, Ets1 mediate FGF1-induced upregulation of Runx2 and catabolic proteins such as MMP13 and ADAMTS5 (Aggrecanase). In the model the end node 'MMP13' can as well represent Aggrecanase expression since they would be upregulated in similar circumstances
Description: MGI:99829, NCBI gene: 12393

RegulatorySummary: PTHrP inhibits Runx2 expression through PKA/CREB2 pathway. In the model, this is translated by direct inhibition of Runx2 at the gene expressio
UpstreamRegulator: Dlx5 induces Runx2 expression by direct binding to its promoter
Description: Runx2 is a master transcription factor for hypertophy during endochondral ossification and it may play a important role in the development of osteoarthritis too

UpstreamRegulator: BMP-2 induces Runx2 expression via Dlx5 but Runx2-induced expression by TGFB1 does not pass by Dlx5
Description: Runt-related transcription factor 2; Transcription factor involved in osteoblastic differentiation and skeletal morphogenesis. Essential for both intramembranous and endochondral ossification.

UpstreamRegulator: Hif-2a upregulates Runx2 promoter activity
Description: Also called Cbfa1 , PEBP2A or Osf2. Disease association database: OMIM600211

UpstreamRegulator: Nkx3/Bapx1 is a transcriptional repressor selectively expressed by proliferative chondrocytes in growth cartilage. Nkx3/Bapx1 inhibits Runx2 expression
Description: The negative feedback loop between Runx2 and Sox9 is crucial for the control of chondroycte stability and hypertophic differenitation, during development and disease

UpstreamRegulator: BMP signalling is required for Nkx3.2 to serve as a transcriptional repressor of chondrogenisis. (NB: stong reference in somitic chondrogenisis, but it is yet to prove in join cartilage maturation, although we can assume that if Nkx3.2 protein and Smad (downstream of BMP) interact in this cell type, they are likely to interact also in join chondrocytes from a docking point of view)
Nkx3.2 represses Runx2 expression as part of a tight positive regulatory system that includes Sox9
the Wnt-mediated induction of Runx2 expression passes by binding of TCF/Lef on the Runx2 promoter.(At least in chicken chodnrocytes)
MEF2C directly upreglate Runx2 expression level and thereby control chondrocyte hypertrophy
"Dlx5 specifically transactivates the Runx2 P1 promoter, and its action on the P1 promoter is antagonized by Msx2."
Ihh signalling promotes Runx2 expression during chondrocgenisis. Gli1 was shown to mediate this effect but Gli2 is the generic transcription factor node downtream of Ihh pathway in the model.
PthrP inhibits Runx2 expression in chondrocytes via PKA/CREB signalling pathway. CREB is the downstream nulcear effector of PKA but it is directly represented by PKA itself in the model
See Nkx3.2

RegulatorySummary: The complex is the result of the association of R-smad and Smad4 so it is activated by those 2 regulators ta the protien level, no transcriptional regulators were found and/or included in the GRN
Description: Smad-complex denotes a complex formed of R-Smads and Smad4. The resulting complex has a transcriptional activity in the nucleus.
It is part of the Bmp canonical pathway but it is also regulated by TGB-beta in articular chondrocytes
Smad4: MGI:894293, NCBI gene: 17128
Smad3: MGI:1201674, NCBI gene: 17127
Dysregulation of Smad3 signal might be involved in both onset and progression of OA. Smad3−/− mice gradually developed an end-stage OA phenotype

The TGF-beta/Smad3 axis promotes pro-anabolic signals and tend to prevent chondrocyte hypertrophy. One of the mode of action might the recruitment of HDAC4 deacetylase to limit Runx2 transcriptional activity
Smad3 transduce TGF-beta signal in chondrocyte
Smad3/Smad2 transduce TGFβ signal in chondrocyte. In presence of TGFβ, Smad3 complexes with co-Smad4 and translocate in the nucleus where it has a transcriptional activity
Smad2 and Smad3 are considered to have similar funcitons in a number of context including cartilage and were represented as a single node in the model for sake of simplification
Smad2 and Smad3 interact with a variety of DNA-binding proteins (e.g. HDAC4) in different contexts, thereby modulation the activity of other transcriptional regulators

UpstreamRegulator: STAT proteins induces Smad7 expression, leading to inhibition of TGF-β signalling
Description: Inhibitory Smads are Smad6 and Smad7. Smad7 inhbits BMPs and TGF-βs signal in multiple ways: preventing R-Smad nuclei translocation, competitively binding with type I receptor to prevent R-Smad phosphorylation, and promoting R-smads or receptor degradation by recruiting E3 ubiquitin ligases Smurf1/2

UpstreamRegulator: NfKb induces Smad7 expression, leading to inhibition of TGFB pathway
Description: Inhibitory Smad. MGI:1100518, NCBI gene:17131

UpstreamRegulator: In OA chondrocytes, IL-1 upregulates SMAD7 expression (an intracellular TGFβ signalling inhibitor) via NF-κB activation
Description: Conditional-overexpression of Smad7 in MSC or stage-specific chondrocytes results in defective mesenchymal condensation, chondrocyte proliferation and chondrocyte maturation, respectively

UpstreamRegulator: "Induction of Smad6 and Smad7 expression by BMP and TGF-β represents an auto-inhibitory feedback mechanism for ligand-induced signalling"
Description: TGF-β superfamily ligands can induce expression of the I-Smads, suggesting that these Smads act as part of an autocrine negative feedback loop

UpstreamRegulator: SmadComplex is the canonical downstream effector of BMP signalling
Smad3 is the canonical downstream effector of TGFB signalling

RegulatorySummary: Insulin-like growth factors related pathway may lead to the induction of SOCS, which inhibits the JAK/STAT axis in return; as a feedback inhibition.
UpstreamRegulator: FGF2 siganlling in chondrocytes induces expression of CIS, SOCS1 and SOC3 inhibitors of cytokine receptors, which is likely mediated by the FGFR3 related pathway
Description: Suppressors of cytokine signaling -1 (Socs1). MGI:1354910, NCBI Gene: 12703

UpstreamRegulator: Insulin-like growth factors related pathway may lead to the induction of SOCS, which inhibits the JAK/STAT axis in return; as a feedback inhibition.
Description: SOCS are soluble inhibitors of pro-inflammatory cytokines receptors, they prevent the downstream phosphorylation cascades.
They also negatively regulate the JAK/STAT pathway during osteoarthritis

RegulatorySummary: Phosphorylation of SOX9 by cyclic AMP-dependent protein kinase A enhances SOX9 transcriptional activity
UpstreamRegulator: p38 is the transcription factor at the origin of BMP2-induced Sox9 expression. BMP-2/p38 rather than BMP-2/Smad pathway is responsible for modulating the function of Sox9 during chondrogenesis
Description: SRY (sex determining region Y)-box 9 (Sox9) MGI:98371, NCBI gene: 20682

UpstreamRegulator: Nkx3.2 and Sox9 could induce each other expression, thereby forming a positive regulatory loop. It would somehow depends on BMP presence.(Reference 'Zeng L. is not really context specific since relative to chondrogenisis in the somites)
Description: DNA-binding protein. It is one of the major transcription factor involved during chondrocyte differentiation. Deficiencies lead to the skeletal malformation syndrome campomelic dysplasia, frequently with sex reversal

UpstreamRegulator: PKA is a protein kinase and CREB is a prototypical PKA downstream transcription factor transducing PKA signalling in the nucleus. Its nuclear action is directly operated by PKA in the model.
CREB (activated by PKA) binds to Sox9 promoter and upregulates its expression
Sox9 regulates its own activity in chondrocyte via a positive feedback loop
Sox9 is involved in an autoregultaory loop wth Nkx3.2. Sox9 can maintain its own expression
Sox9 is a target of NfkB as a binding site of NfkB was found in Sox9 promotor region. Two different sites
NFkB could both stimulate and suppress Sox9 activity depending on other unknown factors
Reference for upregulation
Reference for repression

Description: signal transducer and activator of transcription-1 (STAT1) MGI:103063 , NCBI gene:20846
Stat1 is located downstream of FGF pathway and control expression of target genes in the nucleus. FGF control chondrocyte proliferation in part through STAT1
STAT1-p21 signalling mediates the inhibitory effects of FGFR3 on endochondral ossification & in pathological conditions
STAT1 has a transcriptional activity in the nucleus in the form of homodimers

STAT proteins are activated by phosphorylation thanks to JAK kinases. Intermediary JAK are not represented in the model for reason of simplification. The Stat1 in the model represents JAK/Stat1 pathway.
Stat1 is upregulated in rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis

STAT1, originally identified as a signal transducing molecule in the interferon (IFN) pathway, is activated by tyrosine phosphorylation to dimerize and translocate into the nucleus where it then functions as a transcriptional regulator

RegulatorySummary: Activated at protein level, no transcriptional regulators were found and/or included in the GRN model. It does not have transcriptional activity.See protein signaling subnetwork for more information
Description: TGF-β-activating kinase (TAK1 or Map3k7). MGI:1346877. NCBI Gene: 26409

After binding to membrane receptors (e.g. Toll-like receptors for Il-B), a kinases phosphorylation cascade takes place involving IRAK and TGF-β-activating kinase (TAK1), this linear transduction is summarized under the node TAK1 in the model Downstream of TAK1, pro-inflammatory stimuli are transduced via different pathways involving p38, ERK1/2, JNK and Nf-kB
Pro-inflammatory cytokine pathways converge towards the activaction of TAK1 (via IRAK and other intermediraies not represented here)
TAK1 is activated by cascades of ubiquitinationa and phosphorylation
Tak1 is essential for articular cartilage, notably because it is able to regulate SOX9 expression (indirectly)

UpstreamRegulator: TGFB signalling would be regulated by Ihh/Gli2 signalling (NB: reference discutable)
Description: Transforming growth factor, beta (e.g. Tgfb1): MGI:98725, NCBI gene: 21803

UpstreamRegulator: FGF1 (2) treatment in chondrocyte was shown to increase quantity of TGFbeta protein (directly related to expression level in this model). Ets1 is the transcription factor acting as the effector downstream of FGF/ERK1/2 pathway
Description: TGF-beta plays a key role in chondrocyte hypertophy and cartilage homeostasis. Modification of this pathway may lead to osteoarthritis and it is claimed to be a potential way of action for candidate drugs. Downstream effects depend on the receptors ALK1/ALK5 ratio, which changes with ageing and in OA

By binding to different receptors of the activin-receptor like kinase (ALK) family, TGFβ induces intracellular carboxy-terminal (C-terminal) phosphorylation of receptor-regulated Smad (R-Smad) proteins. The type of activated receptor will define which R-smad are activated knowing that in cartilage, phosphorylated Smad2/3 and Smad1/5 have opposing functions regarding stable chondrocytes maintenance

TGF-β superfamily members act through a heteromeric receptor complex, comprised of type I and type II receptors (TβRI & TβRII) at the cell surface that transduce intracellular signals via Smad3, Smad complex or the non-canonical-Smad-independent signaling pathway (that is, p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase/p38 MAPK)

Mice expressing a dominant negative TβRII exhibit articular cartilage degeneration similar to that observed in human OA. Abnormal expression of type X collagen is found in the articular cartilage of these mice

Active TGFβ is a 25 kD dimer that signals via heteromeric complexes of transmembrane serine/threonine type I and type II receptors, most commonly tetramers composed of two type I and two type II receptors. The type I receptors, also termed activin receptor-like kinases (ALKs), act downstream of type II receptors and determine receptor specificity. The canonical signalling route of TGFβ is via the broadly expressed type I receptor ALK5, but in chondrocytes and other cell types additional ALKs, such as ALK1, can be involved

RegulatorySummary: DKK and FRZB are antognist of Wnt
UpstreamRegulator: Hh signalling would promote hypertrophy in a n PthrP-independant pathway. This effect would pass by upregulation of Wnt ligands expression (including Wnt3a) and thus activation of Wnt/b-catenin pathway and downstream targets.
Description: Wingless-type MMTV integration site family, several types exist; e.g. Wnt3a, MGI:98955, NCBI gene: 22416

UpstreamRegulator: Msx2 would upregulate wnt promoter
Description: WNTs are growth factors that play a vital role in proliferation and hypertrophy of chondrocytes. There are essential for joint health.

Wnt pathway summary: The pathway is initiated bythe binding of WNT ligands to the WNT receptor (frizzled)/co-receptor (lipoprotein receptor-related protein-LRP-5/6) complex, triggering a conformational change in the downstream molecule complex that consist of Dishevelled, adenomatosis polyposis coli (APC), axin, glycogen synthase kinase 3β (GSK3β), β-catenin, and other proteins. Through sequential changes in interaction and phosphorylation status of these proteins, phosphorylation of the amino-terminal domain of β-catenin is disturbed, leading to stabilization and nuclear translocation of β-catenin. The nuclear-translocated β-catenin stimulates transcription of the target genes with co-transcription factors such as T-cell factor/lymphoid-enhancing factor (TCF/LEF) family
Wnt is reported as a risk factor in Osteoarthritis
WNT promotes hypertrophy through activation of Runx2 transcription factor
